go out.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to leave your house, especially in order to enjoy yourself
go out.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We went out for a meal and then on to a movie.
Liam goes out drinking every Friday.
Can I go out to play now?
You should go out and get some fresh air.
go out.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to have a romantic relationship with someone
go out.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: They’ve been going out for two years now.
Tina used to go out with my brother.
How long have you been going out together?
go out.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to be broadcast on television or radio
go out.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The programme goes out live at 5 o’clock on Mondays.
go out.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: A copy of the instructions should go out with the equipment.
The magazine goes out to all members at the end of the month.
go out.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to stop playing in a competition because you have lost a game
go out.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: He went out in the first round.
go out.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to travel to another country in order to live and work there
go out.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: They are looking for nurses to go out to Saudi Arabia.
go out.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to stop being fashionable or used
go out.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: Hats like that went out years ago.
This kind of entertainment went out with the ark (=is very old-fashioned).
go out.translation[0].definitions[8].def: when the tide goes out, the sea moves away from the land
go out.translation[0].definitions[9].def: if news or a message goes out, it is officially announced to everyone
go out.translation[0].definitions[9].exa: The appeal went out for food and medicines.
go out.translation[0].definitions[10].de: used to say that you feel sympathy for someone and are thinking about them
go out.translation[0].definitions[10].ex: Our hearts go out to the victim’s family.
go out.translation[0].definitions[11].ex: March went out with high winds and rain.
